page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: The twelve square block 03880228 lies just South of the market town of Tewkesbury in the{Severn Vale}to the East of the River Severn and some four miles to the West of the Cotswold Hills. This flat, low-lying area is agricuturally picturesque with its patchwork landscape given over to cereal, crops and pasture land for dairy cattle and sheep. There are three small{villages serving this sparsely populated area: Tredington, which occupies a central position; Deerhurst Walton in the South West and the Western outskirts of Stoke Orchard which lies to the South East. The{agricultural land}is shared between nine farms and the only sign of industrial development is the Coal Research Depot at Stoke Orchard. .
